column4: hey I've installed windows again and now It has overrided the boot screen
but when I try to install now Ubuntu doesn't show my partitions... just the entire disk... so I'm afraid of loosing my entire HDD ?
you mean you repartitioned your disk and erased ubuntu?

no, I had ubuntu in the ext3 partition at hda6 but had win in hda1 and data in hda5, but after reinstalled windows on the hda1 grub was gone and Ubuntu istaller doesn't give me the option to choose hda6 (ext3) anymore
oh no! another problem nooo :P really?
if the partition was overwritten, that's certainly a problem.  Installing windows shouldn't do that, but it isn't all that difficult a mistake to make
oh its not overriden... just doesn't appear
the only way I know of to make it "not appear" is to rewrite the partition table without it.
if in fact it isn't overwritten, and you know the boundaries, you can re-establish it with fdisk
but I'm still a bit confused.  If you had installed ubuntu and used /dev/hda5, why are we talking about hda6?
or did I get that wrong

well lemme explain u again anyways heh, I have 3 partitions here, hda1 = ntfs that has windows on it, hda5 = ntfs taht has data on it and hda6 = ext3 that has ubuntu, but since I had to format hda1 yo reinstall windows the grub was gone, and I can't use Ubuntu anymore coz windows boots automatically
but when I try to reinstall Ubuntu the installer gives me just on choice, the entire hdd as 'HDA 80GB', so I'm afraid coz before I used to have the 3 partitions
